title: Possibly a Baskerville?
author: steve_p

comments.content:
You guessed it. Bitstream’s version would do the trick:  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/bitstream/baskerville/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150320090953/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/bitstream/baskerville/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/bitstream/baskerville/")

Ah, that's the one - thanks  
(I'd looked at Fountain & Storm's versions - and Mrs Eaves - but they all had a more ornate 'w'. They might be more 'authentic' Baskervilles, but I prefer the simpler Bitstream one you've linked to...)
